Text: NP winky, I intend on posting the whole collection, but I will limit it to 4-5 movies a week so that everyone who wants them all has a chance to seed before going to the next film.
Awesome, nice clean rip. Thanks. I like to revisit this movie once and a while and haven't seen it in years. good up.

paulauster47, I do not know if it works on a Mac but I normally use the Subresync function in the popular VobSub program. It is a bit time consuming though because you have to enter a value for each letter, it's capitalized version, punctuation and numbers. I doubt I would do a good job with French but if you have 15 minutes and a bit of patience you should be ok.
I should also mention you could also get a player that decodes vob/idx subtitles and works on a Mac , like VLC (http://www.videolan.org/vlc).

For Mac Users: to convert [text] .sub files to .srt use the freeware app Sub2Srt.  It won't work with .idx/.sub files though.
